body: Just made the commit, basically what was happening is that you needed to 'refresh cache' to see the changes. It's a common thing that happens, if you're making css changes and you don't see the changes try refreshing and deleting cache. In safari, it's "shift + refreshing" and I am sure it's the same in chrome but you can google it, anyway, I removed the commented styling code because your css code is working beautifully, I also added some hovering css because the text was going blue. Everything looks really good now I think, I'm gonna approve this pull request.

Agreed with @JeSuisAhmedN that a script tag is bad within a `.html` file - we want to separate concerns between files and we want the js code to reside in a js specific folder inside a file named `somefilename.js`
